sen.j: 同志社英学校（どうししゃえいがっこう）は、新島襄が1875年に京都に創設した私立学校。
sen.e: Doshisha English School (Doshisha Eigakko) is a private school that Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA) established in Kyoto in 1875.
Doshisha English School (Doshisha Eigakko) is a private school that Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA) established in Kyoto in 1875.
Doshisha English School (Doshisha Eigakko) is a private school that Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA) established in Kyoto in 1875.

sen.j: 同志社大学の前身。
sen.e: It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.
It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.
It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.

sen.j: 文部科学省認定山川出版社詳説日本史 改訂版に大隈重信の東京専門学校（現、早稲田大学）、福澤諭吉の慶應義塾（現、慶應義塾大学）と並び記載されている。
sen.e: It is mentioned along with Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University, as of now) established by Shigenobu OKUMA and Keio Gijuku (Keio University, as of now) established by Yukichi FUKUZAWA in the textbook titled a detailed history of Japan revised edition published by Yamakawa Publishing Company and authorized by Ministry of Education.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is mentioned along with Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University, as of now) established by Shigenobu OKUMA and Keio Gijuku (Keio University, as of now) established by Yukichi FUKUZAWA in the textbook titled "A detailed history of Japan revised edition" published by Yamakawa Publishing Company and authorized by the Ministry of Education.

It is mentioned along with Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University, as of now) established by Shigenobu OKUMA and Keio Gijuku (Keio University, as of now) established by Yukichi FUKUZAWA in the textbook titled "A detailed history of Japan revised edition" published by Yamakawa Publishing Company and authorized by the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 日本三大私学の一つ。
sen.e: It is one of three Japanese eminent private schools.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is one of three eminent Japanese private schools.
It is one of three eminent Japanese private schools.

sen.j: 同志社大学の前身。
sen.e: It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.
It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.
It is the forerunner of Doshisha University.

tit.e: The spirit of establishing the school
The spirit of establishing the school

sen.j: 同志社の建学精神はキリスト教精神に基づく「良心」である。
sen.e: The spirit of establishing Doshisha is 'conscience' based on the spirit of Christianity.
The spirit of establishing Doshisha is 'conscience' based on the spirit of Christianity.
The spirit of establishing Doshisha is 'conscience' based on the spirit of Christianity.

sen.j: 新島襄は建学の目的として、「良心を手腕に運用する人物」の育成を掲げた。
sen.e: Joseph Hardy Neesima declared the aim of establishing school to be the nurturing of 'people who operate conscience with skills'.
Joseph Hardy Neesima declared the aim of establishing the school to be the nurturing of 'people who operate with conscience and skills.'
Joseph Hardy Neesima declared the aim of establishing the school to be the nurturing of 'people who operate with conscience and skills.'

sen.j: 知識教育に偏ることのないよう、キリスト教に基づく「徳育」を並行して進めることで、「良心の全身に充満」した人々を輩出したいと願ったのである。
sen.e: He wished to foster people 'filled with conscience to their whole bodies' by not leaning toward intellectual education but conducting Tokuiku (Teaching of virtue) based on Christianity alongside.
He wished to foster people 'filled with conscience to their whole bodies' by not leaning toward intellectual education but conducting Tokuiku (Teaching of virtue) based on Christianity alongside.
He wished to foster people 'filled with conscience to their whole bodies' by not leaning toward intellectual education but conducting 'Tokuiku' (Teaching of virtue) based on Christianity alongside.

sen.j: その思いを彼の筆跡のまま刻んだ碑が、今出川・京田辺両キャンパスの正面入口にある。
sen.e: There are monuments engraved his thought by his handwriting at the front entrances of both campuses of Imadegawa and Kyotanabe.
There are monuments engraved with his thoughts, handwritten at the front entrances of both campuses of Imadegawa and Kyotanabe.
There are monuments engraved with his thoughts, handwritten at the front entrances of both campuses of Imadegawa and Kyotanabe.

sen.j: この良心碑には、「良心之全身ニ充満シタル丈夫ノ起リ来ラン事ヲ」という言葉が刻まれている。
sen.e: The following words are engraved on these conscience monuments: May healthy men filled with conscience to their whole bodies appear.
The following words are engraved on these conscience monuments: May healthy men filled with conscience to their whole bodies appear.
The following words are engraved on these conscience monuments: May healthy men filled with conscience to their whole bodies appear.

sen.j: また、この「良心」教育を具体的に実現するための教育理念として、「キリスト教主義」「自由主義」「国際主義」が掲げられ、これらを通じて「一国の良心」たる人物を輩出することを目指している。
sen.e: And as the educational philosophy to realize this 'conscience' education concretely, 'Christian principles', 'liberalism' and 'internationalism' have been upheld, and it has aimed at fostering people as 'the nation's conscience' through these.

And as the educational philosophy to realize this 'conscience' education concretely, 'Christian principles,' 'liberalism,' and 'internationalism' have been upheld, and it has aimed at fostering people as 'the nation's conscience' through these.

And as the educational philosophy to realize this 'conscience' education concretely, 'Christian principles,' 'liberalism,' and 'internationalism' have been upheld, and it has aimed at fostering people as 'the nation's conscience' through these.

sen.j: 1875年 新島襄が京都寺町に同志社英学校を開校する。
sen.e: In 1875, Joseph Hardy Neesima established Doshisha English School at Teramachi, Kyoto.
In 1875, Joseph Hardy Neesima established Doshisha English School at Teramachi, Kyoto.
1875: Joseph Hardy Neesima established Doshisha English School at Teramachi, Kyoto.

sen.j: 教員2人、生徒8人。
sen.e: Two teachers and eight students.
Two teachers and eight students.
Two teachers and eight students.

sen.j: 1876年 山本覚馬から寄贈された今出川校地（相国寺二本松の旧薩摩藩邸跡地）に移転。
sen.e: In 1876, it was relocated to a site in Imadegawa (the vacant lot of the former residence of Satsuma Domain in Shokoku-ji Nihonmatsu) donated by Kakuma YAMAMOTO.
In 1876, it was relocated to a site in Imadegawa (the vacant lot of the former residence of the Satsuma Domain in Shokoku-ji Nihonmatsu) donated by Kakuma YAMAMOTO.
1876: It was relocated to a site in Imadegawa (the vacant lot of the former residence of the Satsuma Domain in Shokoku-ji Nihonmatsu) donated by Kakuma YAMAMOTO.

sen.j: この時、熊本バンド約35人が入学。
sen.e: About thirty-five members of Kumamoto Band entered the school at this time.
About thirty-five members of the Kumamoto Band entered the school at this time.
About 35 members of the Kumamoto Band entered the school at this time.

sen.j: 1887年 医学校（医学部）構想の一環として、同志社病院・京都看病婦学校を創設。
sen.e: In 1887, Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established as a part of Medical School (Faculty of Medicine) plan.
In 1887, Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established as a part of the Medical School (Faculty of Medicine) plan.
1887: Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established as a part of the Medical School (Faculty of Medicine) plan.

sen.j: 1888年 「同志社大学設立の旨意」を全国の主要な雑誌・新聞に発表。
sen.e: In 1888, The Aim in Establishing Doshisha University' was published in major nationwide magazines and newspapers.
In 1888, The Aim in Establishing Doshisha University' was published in major nationwide magazines and newspapers.
1888: 'The Aim in Establishing Doshisha University' was published in major nationwide magazines and newspapers.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に変更文頭の ' 追記

sen.j: 1890年 新島襄永眠。
sen.e: In 1890, Joseph Hardy Neesima passed away.
In 1890, Joseph Hardy Neesima passed away.
1890: Joseph Hardy Neesima passed away.

sen.j: ハリス理化学校（現工学部）を9月に開校。
sen.e: Harris Science School (Faculty of Engineering, as of now) was established in September.
Harris Science School (Faculty of Engineering, as of now) was established in September.
Harris Science School (Faculty of Engineering, as of now) was established in September.

sen.j: 1891年 政法学校開校。
sen.e: In 1891, School of Politics and Law was established.
In 1891, School of Politics and Law was established.
1891: School of Politics and Law was established.

sen.j: 政治学科（現法学部）と理財科（現経済学部）を置く。
sen.e: Department of Political Science (Faculty of Law, as of now) and Department of Economics (Faculty of Economic, as of now) were placed.
Department of Political Science (Faculty of Law, as of now) and Department of Economics (Faculty of Economic, as of now) were placed.
Department of Political Science (Faculty of Law, as of now) and Department of Economics (Faculty of Economic, as of now) were placed.

sen.j: 1893年 同志社徽章を制定。
sen.e: In 1893, the emblem of Doshisha was adopted.
In 1893, the emblem of Doshisha was adopted.
1893: The emblem of Doshisha was adopted.

sen.j: 1904年 専門学校令による神学校と専門学校を開校。
sen.e: In 1904, School of Theology and senmon gakko (professional school) were established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.
In 1904, School of Theology and senmon gakko (professional school) were established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.
1904: School of Theology and senmon gakko (professional school) were established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.

sen.j: 政法学校、理化学校などは廃止もしくは統合。
sen.e: School of Politics and Law, Science School and so on were discontinued or integrated.
School of Politics and Law, Science School and so on were discontinued or integrated.
School of Politics and Law, Science School and so on were discontinued or integrated.

sen.j: 1908年 同志社カレッジソング制定。
sen.e: In 1908, Doshisha College Song was adopted.
In 1908, Doshisha College Song was adopted.
1908: Doshisha College Song was adopted.

sen.j: 1911年 専門学校として再編成し、神学部、英語師範部、高等商業部（現商学部）、政治経済部の4部を置く。
sen.e: In 1911, it was reorganized as a senmon gakko (professional school), and four faculties consisting of School of Theology, Faculty of English Teaching, Faculty of Higher Commerce (Faculty of Commerce, as of now) and Faculty of Political Science and Economics were established.

In 1911, it was reorganized as a senmon gakko (professional school), and four faculties consisting of School of Theology, Faculty of English Teaching, Faculty of Higher Commerce (Faculty of Commerce, as of now) and Faculty of Political Science and Economics were established.

1911: It was reorganized as a senmon gakko (professional school), and four faculties consisting of School of Theology, Faculty of English Teaching, Faculty of Higher Commerce (Faculty of Commerce, as of now) and Faculty of Political Science and Economics were established.

sen.j: 1912年 専門学校令により同志社大学（神学部、政治経済学部、英文科）を開校。
sen.e: In 1912, Doshisha University (School of Theology, Faculty of Political Science and Economics and Department of English) was established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.
In 1912, Doshisha University (School of Theology, Faculty of Political Science and Economics and Department of English) was established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.
1912: Doshisha University (School of Theology, Faculty of Political Science and Economics and Department of English) was established under the Senmon Gakko (professional school) Ordinance.

sen.j: 1920年 関西地区で初めて大学令に基づいて大学に昇格。
sen.e: In 1920, it was raised to the first University in Kansai area by the University Ordinance.
In 1920, it was raised to the first University in Kansai area by the University Ordinance.
1920: It was raised to the first University in Kansai area by the University Ordinance.

sen.j: 同志社大学文学部（神学科、英文学科）、法学部（政治学科、経済学科）、大学院、予科を開校。
sen.e: Doshisha University, consisting of Faculty of Letters (Department of Theology and Department of English), Faculty of Law (Department of Political Science and Department of Economics), Graduate School and Preparatory School, was established.

Doshisha University, consisting of Faculty of Letters (Department of Theology and Department of English), Faculty of Law (Department of Political Science and Department of Economics), Graduate School and Preparatory School, was established.

Doshisha University, consisting of Faculty of Letters (Department of Theology and Department of English), Faculty of Law (Department of Political Science and Department of Economics), Graduate School and Preparatory School, was established.

sen.j: 基礎データ
sen.e: Basic Data
Basic Data

sen.j: 象徴
sen.e: Symbols
Symbols
Symbols

sen.j: 徽章
sen.e: Emblem
Emblem
Emblem

sen.j: 正三角形を3つ寄せたもので、国あるいは土を意味するアッシリア文字「ムツウ」を図案化したもの。
sen.e: It is a pattern of three triangles gathered, stylizing an Assyrian letter 'matu' meaning a nation or a land.
It is a pattern of three triangles gathered, stylizing an Assyrian letter 'matu' meaning a nation or a land.
It is a pattern of three triangles gathered, stylizing an Assyrian letter 'matu' meaning a nation or a land.

sen.j: 知・徳・体の三位一体あるいは調和をめざす同志社の教育理念をあらわすものと解釈されている。
sen.e: It is interpreted as a symbol of Doshisha' s educational philosophy aiming at the harmony of three elements of education: Intellectual, moral and physical educations.
It is interpreted as a symbol of Doshisha' s educational philosophy aiming at the harmony of three elements of education: intellectual, moral and physical educations.
It is interpreted as a symbol of Doshisha' s educational philosophy aiming at the harmony of three elements of education: intellectual, moral and physical educations.

sen.j: 考案者は湯浅半月。
sen.e: It was designed by Hangetsu Yuasa.
It was designed by Hangetsu Yuasa.
It was designed by Hangetsu YUASA.
sen.cmt: 半月は雅号ですが、湯浅は名字なのでYUASAとしました。

sen.j: スクールカラー
sen.e: School Color
School Color
School Color

sen.j: 紫（古代紫と江戸紫の中間色）と白の２色。
sen.e: Two colors of purple(a medium color between Tyrian purple and Edo purple) and white.
Two colors of purple (a medium color between Tyrian purple and Edo purple) and white.
Two colors of purple (a medium color between Tyrian purple and Edo purple) and white.

sen.j: 創立者新島襄の母校、アマースト大学のスクールカラーと同色。
sen.e: It is the same school color as that of Amherst College where the founder, Joseph Hardy Neesima, studied.
It is the same school color as that of Amherst College where the founder, Joseph Hardy Neesima, studied.
It is the same school color as that of Amherst College where the founder, Joseph Hardy Neesima, studied.

sen.j: 校歌
sen.e: College Song
College Song
College Song

sen.j: Doshisha College Song（ウィリアム・メレル・ヴォーリズ作詞・Carl Wilhelm作曲）
sen.e: Doshisha College Song (Words by W.M. Vories, Music by Carl Wilhelm)
Doshisha College Song (Words by W.M. Vories, Music by Carl Wilhelm)
Doshisha College Song (Words by W.M. Vories, Music by Carl Wilhelm)

sen.j: 同志社大学歌（北原白秋作詞・山田耕筰作曲）
sen.e: Doshisha Daigakuka (Words by Hakushu KITAHARA, Music by Kosaku YAMADA)
Doshisha Daigakuka (Words by Hakushu KITAHARA, Music by Kosaku YAMADA)
Doshisha Daigakuka, University song (Words by Hakushu KITAHARA, Music by Kosaku YAMADA)

sen.j: 同志社大学で毎年新入生に配布される、カレッジソング集（CD）に収録されている。
sen.e: They are included in the College Songs Collection (CD) which is distributed to new students in Doshisha University every year.
They are included in the College Songs Collection (CD) which is distributed to new students in Doshisha University every year.
They are included in the College Songs Collection (CD) which is distributed to new students in Doshisha University every year.

sen.j: 2004年度までは同大学グリークラブによる伴奏なしの男声合唱のものが収録されていたが、2005年度からアカペラで混声5人とボイスパーカッションによるアレンジで収録されている。
sen.e: Until 2004, the songs in the CD had been the unaccompanied male chorus virsion sung by the glee club of this University, but since 2005, they have been the virsion of a cappella arrangement consisting of mixed five voices and voice percussions.

Until 2004, the songs in the CD had been the unaccompanied male chorus version sung by the glee club of the University, but since 2005, it has been the a cappella arrangement consisting of five mixed voices and vocal percussions.

Until 2004, the songs in the CD had been the unaccompanied male chorus version sung by the glee club of the University, but since 2005, it has been the a cappella arrangement consisting of five mixed voices and vocal percussions.

sen.j: 編曲、歌は同大学のアカペラサークル 「One Voices」。
sen.e: Arranged and sung by the a cappella circle of the University, 'One Voices'.
Arranged and sung by the a cappella circle of the University, 'One Voices.'
Arranged and sung by the a cappella circle of the University, 'One Voices.'
